sections.heading: 01|Liberal interpretation and construction
sections.text: Effective:January 1, 2002Latest Legislation:Senate Bill 179 - 123rd General AssemblyPDF:Download Authenticated PDFThe sections in Chapter 2151. of the Revised Code, with the exception of those sections providing for the criminal prosecution of adults, shall

sections.heading: the Revised Code shall not affect the authority of the juvenile court to issue a custody or support order under division (A)(1) of section2151
sections.text: 23of the Revised Code or when granting custody of the child to a relative or placing a child under a kinship care agreement.

sections.heading: the Revised Code applies to any child taken into custody
sections.text: The parents, custodian, or guardian of such child, and any attorney at law representing them or the child, shall be entitled to visit such child at any reasonable time, be present at any hearing involving the child, and be given reasonable no
